The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage
For detailed information about the code coverage, see the [test coverage report](https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/28786).
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| ACK | [TheCharlatan](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28786#pullrequestreview-1718170494) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ð to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#27897](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27897) (guix: use GCC 12.3.0 to build releases by fanquake)
* [#25972](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25972) (build: no-longer disable WARN_CXXFLAGS when CXXFLAGS is set by fanquake)
* [#25573](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25573) ([POC] guix: produce a fully `-static-pie` bitcoind by fanquake)
* [#25391](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25391) (guix: Use LTO to build releases by fanquake)
* [#24123](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24123) (build: Pointer Authentication and Branch Target Identification for aarch64 Linux (Guix) by fanquake)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

> I can't see anything obvious that would do that. 

Sent a patch upstream, https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/guix-patches/2023-11/msg00362.html, to see if we can get some unversioned pointers to stable/longterm added.

>Note that using an older version of the kernel headers inside Guix, is not a "hack" for compatibility, and is explicitly recommended against by glibc:

Yet boost doesn't make the same compatibility guarantees, and needs to be checked.

> Sent a patch upstream, https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/guix-patches/2023-11/msg00362.html, to see if we can get some unversioned pointers to stable/longterm added.

No traction on this yet, going to move forward here.

 > Yet boost doesn't make the same compatibility guarantees, and needs to be checked.

I haven't seen anything that would cause issues, let me know / open an issue if you see otherwise.
